questionText: With reference to Census of India consider the following statements:
statements: The first official population census of India was conducted in 1872.

The slogan of Census 2011 is "Our Census, Our Future".

questionText: Recently, 'Al Aqsa' mosque was in news. This mosque is located in _____?
Which of these tributaries is not a north bank tributary of Brahmaputra?
Which of these country does not share an international boundary with Russia?
With reference to Dima Hasao district which of these following is/are not true?
options: It is one of the three hill district of Assam and its headquarter is located at Haflong
It shares boundary with neighbouring states of Nagaland, Manipur and Meghalaya
It is the second largest district of Assam after Karbi Anglong
Laike, highest peak of Assam, is located in the district

questionText: Which of the following pair is incorrect?

Some women of Assam took part in the Civil Disobedience Movement very actively. To mobilize the girls in the National Movement, an organization namely namely the 'Mukti Sangha' was established by a few prominent and leading activists. Their fiery spirited speeches encouraged many young minds to fight for 'Poorna Swaraj'. It was during this movement that at various places of Assam Nari Bahinis or Women Squads were formed for carrying out various programmes of the movement. Examine the above statement and select the one who was not related with the Mukti Sangha.
